intro: Lippia ramboi, commonly known as the Mexican blue sage, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of South America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, gray-green foliage and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties. Lippia ramboi is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
